titleStmt.title: John Cable to James F. Robinson
CWG8964

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Mt Vernon Rockcastle County Ky
To His Excellency Jas F. Robinson Govenor of the .Commonwealth of Ky

Your Petitioner would most Respectfully state that at the August term of the John Cable, he was fined $20Rockcastle Circuit Court00 for gaming. He further states that he was playing a small game at cards and happened to bet a little to make the game interesting for which he was fined. he promises not to do so again and asks your excellency to remit the fine as he is a poor man, and done what he did unthoughtedly.
I hope that you will remit the fine assessed against John Cabble yours truly
Fines remitted except Five dollars & costs

J F Robinson
Jno. Cable
Iss Aug 12. 1863
